      • parseIntRange

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> parseIntRange(java.lang.String place,
                                                                   java.lang.String value,
                                                                   java.lang.StringBuffer errors)
        expands an Integer range into a list of Integers
        The formats are:
        - just an integer
        - a comma-separated list of integers. Ex. 3,5,-10
        - a range from to to. Ex. 3 to 10
        - a range from to to step n. Ex: 3 to 10 step 2 The step must not be negative.
        Parameters:
        place - for error reporting
        value - a string to be parsed
        errors - for appending error messages
        Returns:
        the expanded integer list

      • parseFloatRange

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> parseFloatRange(java.lang.String place,
                                                                   java.lang.String value,
                                                                   java.lang.StringBuffer errors)
        expands a Float range into a list of Integers
        The formats are:
        - just an integer
        - a comma-separated list of integers. Ex. 3.5,5,-10.1
        - a range from to to step n. Ex: 3.5 to 10.2 step 2.6 The step must not be negative.
        Parameters:
        place - for error reporting
        value - a string to be parsed
        errors - for appending error messages
        Returns:
        the expanded integer list

      • crossProduct

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>> crossProduct(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>... lists)
        computes the cross product of the given list.
        Example: [1,2] x [3,4] x {5,6] yields
        [[1, 3, 5], [1, 4, 5], [2, 3, 5], [2, 4, 5], [1, 3, 6], [1, 4, 6], [2, 3, 6], [2, 4, 6]]
        Parameters:
        lists - the list for which the cross product ist to be computed
        Returns:
        the cross product

      • writeTmpFile

        public static java.io.File writeTmpFile(java.lang.String directory,
                                        java.lang.String filename,
                                        java.lang.String text)
        creates a temporary file in a temporary directory and writes the text into that file. An existing file with that name is deleted.
        Parameters:
        directory - the name of the temporary directory
        filename - the name of the file
        text - the text to be written.
        Returns:
        the File object for the new file.

      • numberString

        public static java.lang.String numberString(java.lang.Object n)
        calls the toString method. If the result ends with '.0', it is cut off.
        Parameters:
        n - any object
        Returns:
        its String representation without '.0'
